Section.Label: IdempotTesting
Section.Heading: Testing lists of idempotents for completeness

ManSection.Description:
The input should be formed by a ring R and a list l of elements of R.
Returns true if the l is a complete list of orthogonal idempotents of R, that is if the sum of the elements of l is the identity of R and for every e,f \in l one has e^2=e and e*f=0 if e and occupies different positions in l.
Note that the if a non-zero element r of R appears in two different positions of l then the output is false. However the appearance of one or more zeroes in l do not affect the output.

Chapter.Section:
Idempotents from Shoda pairs
a list of group algebra elements
The input FG should be semisimple group algebra of a finite group G whose coefficient field F is either a finite field or the field Q of rationals.
If F=Q then the output is the list of primitive central idempotents of the group algebra FG realizable by strong Shoda pairs () of G.
If F is a finite field then the output is the list of primitive central idempotents of FG realizable by strong Shoda pairs (K,H) of G and q-cyclotomic classes modulo the index of H in K ().
If the list of primitive central idempotents given by the output is not complete (i.e. if the group G is not strongly monomial () then a warning is displayed.

a list of group algebra elements
The input should be a rational group algebra of a finite group G.
Returns a list containing all the primitive central idempotents e of the rational group algebra QG such that \chi(e)\ne 0 for some irreducible monomial character \chi of G.
The sum of the elements of the output is the identity if and only if G is monomial.
If the list of primitive central idempotents given by the output is not complete then a warning is displayed.
